column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column4: Winding road ahead
column6: Watch for vehicles entering from the side
column8: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed

column2: 2. When approaching a construction site, drivers should:
column4: honk their horn to alert construction workers of their presence.
column6: slow down and adjust their driving manner.
column8: accelerate to get out of the way quickly.

column4: Side road
column6: Side road entering from the left

column4: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column6: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column8: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.

column4: traffic must merge right.
column6: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column4: Emergency line available
column6: Cell phone shop ahead

column2: 7. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.

column2: 8. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: No.
column6: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column8: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 9. When changing lanes, drivers should never:
column4: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.
column6: glance over their shoulder to check for blind spots.

column4: Bicycle crossing
column6: This lane is reserved for bicyclists

column2: 11. When is it safe to pass another vehicle?
column4: When you are driving through an intersection and there are no oncoming vehicles.
column6: When you are entering a curve and there are no oncoming vehicles.
column8: Whenever signs and/or markings permit passing other vehicles.

column2: 12. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column6: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column8: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.

column2: 13. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: stop immediately.
column6: finish crossing the street.
column8: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 14. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column6: to signal all lane changes.
column8: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.

column2: 15. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column4: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.
column6: It prevents skidding.

column4: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM

column4: Merging traffic
column6: Divided highway ends

column2: 18. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Leave the road immediately.
column6: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column8: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

column4: Danger ahead.
column6: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

column2: 20. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column6: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column8: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.

column2: 21. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column6: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column8: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.

column4: slow down when roads are wet.
column6: keep your tires properly inflated.

column4: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.
column6: The center lane is shared for left turns.

column2: 24. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column6: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column8: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 25. When you see a "merging traffic" sign on the freeway, you should:
column4: slow down to allow traffic to enter.
column6: move to another lane to let traffic enter, if safe.
column8: speed up to avoid congesting traffic.

column4: Keep left
column6: Lane ends

column2: 27. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column8: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column4: road construction site.
column6: side road ahead.

column4: narrow bridge ahead.
column6: road construction.

column2: 31. If your car becomes disabled on a highway, you should:
column4: stop in the right lane.
column6: stop where you are.
column8: park with all four wheels off the highway, if possible.

column4: place your foot on the accelerator.
column6: make sure the parking brake is set.
column8: place your foot on the brake pedal.

column4: No U-turns
column6: No left turn

column4: that a divided highway ends
column6: of a reduction of lanes

column4: use the shoulder of a roadway.
column6: share a traffic lane with a vehicle.

column4: Using your high beam lights in the fog
column6: Starring at the road ahead of your vehicle

column4: Trucks have the right-of-way
column6: Hill

column2: 38. Blocking an intersection during rush hour traffic is not permitted:
column4: unless you entered the intersection on a green light.
column6: unless you have the right-of-way.

column4: no U-turn
column6: no left turn

column2: 40. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column4: less dangerous
column6: narrower and shorter
